meanings.definition: To renounce or reject under oath
meanings.sent1: He foreswore his allegiance to the king during the trial.
meanings.sent2: She foreswore her unhealthy habits to improve her health.
meanings.sent3: The cat foreswore chasing mice and decided to befriend them instead.
meanings.sent4: The old tree foreswore its leaves in the fall, standing bare against the sky.
meanings.sent5: The knight foreswore his sword, choosing peace over conflict.

meanings.definition: To swear falsely or commit perjury
meanings.sent1: The witness foreswore his testimony under pressure from the suspect.
meanings.sent2: She foreswore her innocence in court, leading to her own conviction.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous boy foreswore his mischief, but no one believed him.
meanings.sent4: The politician foreswore his promises, leaving his supporters disappointed.
meanings.sent5: The student foreswore cheating on the exam, but the evidence proved otherwise.
